page.title: 14THE FARMS COMPARED
page.content: Vineyards farm has 240 acres and Pegglesworth has 800. The owner of Vineyards farm is a family with two children whereas Pegglesworth is owned by a millionaire! Vineyards farm grows grass, wheat and spring barley to make beer but is mainly a sheep farm. Pegglesworth grows peas, barley and corn and has some woods and grazing fields. In 1980 the family at Vineyards built their own house (they could not afford to buy the old farmhouse with the land). Pegglesworth was bought in a number of seperate lots and is farmed by a farm manager. Both farms have their own electricity and water supplies. Pegglesworth has more equipment and overall is best off. The manager never looks at the farm as his home but the owner of Vineyards enjoys his work at his home.
